page.title: 17BEE-KEEPING IN FINZEAN.
page.content: The ancient art of bee-keeping is still practised by a few residents of the area mainly as a hobby for older people but with one or two youngsters showing a keen interest.One of the apiaries would qualify as a part time occupation for its owner. In early Spring the colonies(in hives) are fed sugar and water but, as the season progresses, honey from{tree {blossom,clover,bell heather and {finally ling heather}is gathered. {Finzean heather honey}is particularly popular.It is feared that the growing popularity of oil-seed rape as a crop may spoil local honey. In Autumn the honey is removed from the hive and extracted from the comb often by the old method of 'squeezing' and gives an attractive blend in a jar selling from Â£1.25 -Â£2.80 .
